quote: What do you think of the O'Brien's   plan to name their baby Sean?
I kind of like it. "Sean." It's   got a nice ring to it.
Except in Bajoran it means   "swamp."
Do the O'Briens know that?
I doubt it.
Someone should tell them.
I nominate you.
Morning.
Neck bothering you again?
It's just a muscle pull.
What is that, the eighth muscle    pull this month?

Actually, I believe Commander Dax    has been treated for seven muscle    pulls, two contusions, and three    cracked ribs. The only person    who's spent more time in the    Infirmary in the past few weeks is    Commander Worf.
Isn't there any way for the two of    you to... you know...
Make love?
... without injuring yourselves?
Interspecies romance isn't without    it's dangers. That's part of the    fun.        Maybe we'll have better luck on    Risa.
Risa? I thought you and Worf were    going to take your vacation on    Earth.
That was Worf's suggestion. I    changed his mind.
From what I hear, Risa makes the    Hoobishan Baths look like a    monastery.
I hope they have a good hospital.       I can't believe you actually    convinced Worf to go to a pleasure    planet with you. He must really    be loosening up.
Come to think of it, neither have   I.
Oh, he's still the same old Worf.
Prune juice. Extra large.
See what I mean?
Captain, commander, Constable.
Dax said you're going to Risa.
Did she?
It's no secret.
Apparently not.
You must be looking forward to it.
I am "looking forward" to spending    some time alone with Lieutenant    Commander Dax.
Isn't he sweet?
We have much to discuss.
About what?
It is a private matter.
Worf is upset that I had lunch    with Captain Boday.
The Gallamite?
His skull is transparent.
And if you couldn't see his    brains, would it make you feel    better?
It is not proper for you to have    lunch with an ex-lover while we    are together.
Worf, we were just talking. You    have to learn to trust me a little    more.
I trust you. But I do not trust    Captain Boday.
I can see it's going to be quite    a trip.
You'll have to tell us all about    it when you get back.
I'm sure she will.
I don't see why you feel the need    to talk about our personal life    with other people.
And I don't see why you feel the    need to control my every move.         Besides, they're not "other    people." Benjamin and Odo are my    friends.
Jadzia. Worf. We've been looking    for you.        I was thinking about this trip    you're taking to Risa.
He's a friend, too.
Julian and I were talking it over,    and we'd like to come along... if    that's all right.
Actually, we were hoping for some    time alone together.
And you'll have it.
Once we get to Risa, you'll never    even see us.
There's no harm in sharing the    runabout.
I suppose not.
Thank you so much.
I'm going to go pack.
Commander...
Do not hug me.
I promise, we'll stay out of your    hair.
Good. Because we...       Have much to discuss.
I wish I was going with you. Dax    and I had some great times on    Risa.
Curzon Dax.
Yes, of course. Curzon.
Have fun.
It's about time you got here. The    rest of us were ready to leave an    hour ago.
What is he doing here?
I've always wanted to go to Risa.    And this seemed like a perfect    opportunity.
He wouldn't give me any time off    unless we promised to take him    with us.
I hope this isn't going to be a    problem.
Why should there be a problem?    We're going to have a wonderful    time.       Now, if you don't mind, Risa    awaits.
Sorry.
Jadzia...
I know, I know. We have much to    discuss.
Let's see. That's a raktajino for    you.       A Tarkalean tea.
Leeta, you're on vacation, not in    Quark's. You don't have to serve    us.
It gives me something to do.    Space travel's so dull. Have you    ever noticed that all the stars    look the same?
Excuse me, but I believe I ordered    a snail juice. Hand-squeezed.
Get it yourself. I'm on vacation.
How much longer until we get    there?
Another six hours.
Six hours.
Tell the Ferengi to return to his    cabin.
You call that a cabin? It's a cot    and a waste disposal unit. It's    so small even I can't stand up in    there. Look. I'm developing a    slouch.
Tell the Ferengi to return to his    cabin. Now.
Quark.
What's he going to do? Turn    around and take me home? Ruin   everyone's vacation?
Coming about. Setting course for    Deep Space Nine.
Okay, okay. You made your point.    I'm going.       But first, I have a little present    for everyone.
(to Bashir, Leeta, and    Dax)   One for you, one for you, one for    you...       And none for you.
What's this?
It's a horga'hn. The Risian    symbol of fertility.
Displaying one to the locals    indicates you're seeking    jamaharon.
What's jamaharon?
I'll show you later.
Oh.
Look, they like each other.
I think I'm going to be sick.
All right, I'm going.
So am I.
Going? Where?
To change into something more    comfortable. You don't think I'm    going to beam down to Risa dressed    like this, do you?
That's a good idea.
When in Rome...
I can't believe we finally made   it.
Well, enjoy your vacation.
We will.
Time to test these babies out.
Oh, ladies.
You seek jamaharon?
I seek whatever you've got.
All that is ours is yours.
I'll take it.
Aren't you uncomfortable in    that uniform?
Starfleet uniforms are designed    for comfort in even the most    extreme environments.
You look so... out of place. I    mean, look around you. Isn't it    beautiful?

It's an artificially created    paradise, maintained by the most    elaborate weather control system    in the Federation. In it's    natural state, Risa is nothing but    a rain soaked, geologically    unstable jungle.
Maybe so, but right now the only    dark cloud I can see is you.
I did not come here to admire the    scenery.
If you say so.
I guess we might as well go home.
I wouldn't be so hasty.
I take it the scenery has    improved?
A few months ago, when I was    commanding the Defiant on a    scouting mission into the Gamma    Quadrant, we encountered a    protostar cluster.
A swirling mass of color, set    against a background of glowing    clouds and burning sky. It was    the most beautiful thing I ever    saw... until now.
I've got to take you on vacation    more often.
Dax? Is that you?
Arandis. I was wondering if you    were still here.
Not only am I still here, I've    been promoted. I'm Chief    Facilitator for the entire Temtibi   Lagoon.
Worf, this is Arandis.
A friend of Curzon's.
She and Curzon spent a lot of time    together on his last trip here.
We had a wonderful time.       Until I killed him.
Killed him?
Death by jamaharon.       I suppose there are worse ways    To go.
Trust me. He died happy.
He was a very sweet old man.
I'll take your word for it.
It's good to see you again, Dax.   Your new host is very attractive.
I like to think so. You haven't   aged a day.
Risa's been kind to me.
Come on. Let me show you around   the lagoon.
Maybe later.
Of course.       All that is ours is yours.
Thank you. But we have everything    we need.
That wasn't very nice.
Why? Is there something of hers    you want?
Arandis was Curzon's lover, not    mine.
I hope you remember that.
You're still angry about Captain    Boday.
If I am angry, it's because you do    not take our relationship    seriously.
Worf, we just got here. Do we    have to start arguing again?
If you were a Klingon woman, we    would already be married.
In case you haven't noticed, I'm    not a Klingon woman.
That's no excuse. I have been    loyal to you. And I expect you to be    loyal to me in return.
I have been loyal to you. But I'm    not going to let you run my life.
I'm not trying to run your life.
Good. Then I'm going to go have    a nice big glass of icoberry juice.
That would be a mistake. You are    allergic to icoberry juice. It    makes your spots itch.
But I like the taste.
Fine. Have as much icoberry juice    as you like.       But it is a mistake.
But it's my mistake to make.       Now what do you say you go up to    our room, put on a bathing suit,    and we'll go for a swim in the lagoon.
As you wish.
Hurry back.
Come in.
scene: 19   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: I hope I'm not disturbing you...        ... lieutenant commander. My name    is Pascal Fullerton. I'm the    Chairman of the New Essentialists    Movement.
scene: 19   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: I'm not familiar with that    organization.
scene: 19   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: We're dedicated to restoring the    moral and cultural traditions of   the Federation.
scene: 19   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: This is our statement of    principles. And if you want to    hear more, we're holding a rally    later this afternoon.
scene: 19   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: On Risa?
scene: 19   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: What better place? This world    revels in the kind of self-   indulgence that's eroding the    foundations of Federation society.   And we intend to shut it down.
scene: 19   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: I really wish you'd stop reading    that.
I would not dismiss Fullerton so    quickly. His analysis of recent    Federation history is insightful.    And very disturbing.
What's disturbing is that you're    still wearing that uniform.
It would not hurt you to read    this.
Mmm.

The truth is, not everyone can be    a dabo girl. First of all, you    have to be able to wear the    clothes, and believe me, that's    not easy. You have to be able to    calculate odds in your head very    quickly, and most importantly, you    need a very supple wrist.
Like this. Dabo.
Worf, people have been predicting    the end of the Federation since    the day it was founded. Trust me,   I know...
Oh, hi.
Leeta... what a surprise.
Care to join us? We were just    about to take a reyamilk soak.
Maybe later.
That was not Doctor Bashir.
Worf, it's none of our business.
Are you defending her actions?
I'm not defending anything. It's    not my business... or yours.       Now what do you say we sign out a    couple of floaters and take in the    sights.
I cannot. The Essentialists are    having a rally and I'm going to    attend.
You're kidding.       You're not kidding.
Don't these people have anything    better to do?
Perhaps you underestimate the    power of Fullerton's message.
The plot thickens.
And you were worried about Julian.
Why are he and Leeta not together?
I don't know. But don't jump to    conclusions. I'm sure there's a    reasonable explanation.
This place is a bad influence on    people.
Here for the show?
I would not call it a show.
Really? I find Mister Fullerton    very entertaining.
He seems pretty determined to    discourage people from coming here.
Risa receives millions of visitors    every year. And all of them leave    happier than when they arrived.    I don't see how one man, no matter    how determined, could change that.
Kahless fought off an entire army    at Three Turn Bridge. And he was    only one man.

Fullerton and his Essentialists    have been here for almost a month.   And no matter how many speeches he    gives, the water is still warm,   and the wind still smells sweet.        But if he's enjoying himself, who    are we to discourage him?

That's right. Take a good look.    I can only imagine what you must    think of me. A middle-aged,    ponderous academic, sweating under    the hot Risian suns, wasting his    time telling you things you don't   want to hear.       But you know what I see when I    look at you? Children. Pampered    spoiled children.
Am I wrong, or have we just been   insulted?

Somehow the citizens of the    Federation have come to believe    that they're entitled to lives of    ease and privilege. If you want    something to eat, you get it from    a replicator. If you want    amusement, you go to a holosuite.   And if you need protection, you    call for Starfleet. But someday,    someday soon, you're going to have    to learn to take care of yourselves.

Because if I see you as helpless    children, then how do you think    the Borg see you? Or the    Romulans? Or the Klingons or the   Dominion? These empires look at    the Federation and they see a   prize, a prize we've forgotten how    to protect. And if we don't    change our ways, they're going to    take it from us.
Mister Fullerton certainly has a    flair for the dramatic.
Does he really believe that?
I think he does.
The way I see it, we've got two    options. We can either turn our    backs on childish things and re-   embrace the hard work that built    the Federation in the first    place...
... or we can lie here, napping in    the sun, until we wake up with    Jem'Hadar guns to our heads. The    choice is ours. Heaven help us if    we make the wrong one.
Worf, you can't be serious.

I am merely observing that the    Klingons never would have attacked    if they hadn't believed the    Federation was vulnerable. Even   now, after the changeling on the    Klingon High Council was exposed,    some of my people continue to call    for war. Because they think they    can win.
None of which has anything to do    with Risa.
You cannot be certain of that.
All I know is I've spent lifetimes    defending the Federation, and I    deserve a vacation every now and    then.
Julian.
There you are.
I'm so glad we came here. I'm    having the most wonderful time.
I told you this was just what we    needed.
Something wrong?
It's nothing.
The two of you dishonor each other    with your actions.
Do you know what he's talking about?
You mean, we never told you why we    came here?
We're conducting the Rite of    Separation.
It's an old Bajoran custom. When    a couple separates, they spend    several days celebrating their    parting. It's a way to remember    all the good times, and to seek    out new... opportunities.
It's a wise and ancient culture.
You know, Julian, I don't think    I've completely gotten you out of    my system yet.
I know exactly what you mean.       Excuse us. We have a few    little... details to work out.
Terminating a relationship should    not be treated so... frivolously.
Not every relationship has to end    like a Klingon opera.
No. Only the ones that mean    something.
Stay where you are.
On three. One...
Wait.
That's enough.
Well, I hope we've proved our   point.
The power cells are empty.
We have no intention of hurting   anyone.
I don't understand.
You think you're safe here in this    "paradise" of yours. But you're    not. What if we had been    Jem'Hadar or Klingons or Romulans.    You'd all be dead.

Even you -- Starfleet officers --    were lulled into a false sense of    security. If you can be taken    unaware, what chance do the rest    of us have?       The sad truth is... the galaxy is    a hostile place. Forget that,    even for a moment, and you risk    losing everything.
Just something to think about    while you wait for your desserts.
As a Starfleet Officer, I have the    authority to arrest you for what    you just did.
But that would be a waste of time.    We both know the Risians won't    prosecute. They don't have the    courage for it. Believe me, I    wish they did.
what did you think of our little    demonstration, Commander Worf?
I can't condone what you did.
Maybe not, but I think you   understand it.
I don't know about you, but it's    past my bedtime.
scene: 37   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - NIGHT

quote: We need to talk.
scene: 37   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - NIGHT

quote: About the Essentialists?
scene: 37   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - NIGHT

quote: About us.
scene: 37   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - NIGHT

quote: Oh, I suppose you've got another    list of things I'm doing wrong.
scene: 37   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - NIGHT

quote: I didn't say you were doing    anything wrong. It's just that    some of your behavior...
scene: 37   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - NIGHT

quote: What about my behavior?
scene: 37   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - NIGHT

quote: At times, you are too impulsive.    You act without thinking. You    have no self-control.
scene: 37   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - NIGHT

quote: And you think I need you to    control me?
scene: 37   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - NIGHT

quote: Jadzia, you are my Par'machkai.    And that means everything you do    reflects on me.
scene: 37   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - NIGHT

quote: I'm sorry if I embarrass you.
scene: 37   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - NIGHT

quote: I just want to know that you take    this relationship as seriously as    I do.
scene: 37   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - NIGHT

quote: And I just wish you'd relax a    little and let yourself enjoy what    we have together.       Worf, I'm not going to change who    I am.
scene: 37   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - NIGHT

quote: Nor am I.
scene: 37   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - NIGHT

quote: Well, at least we agree on    something. Now, what do you say    we go to bed.
scene: 37   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - NIGHT

quote: You go. I will be there shortly.
scene: 37   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - NIGHT

quote: This place looks a lot better than    it did last night. I guess    Risians aren't as lethargic as the    Essentialists would like everyone    to believe.
The Essentialists are wrong about    many things.       What that Mister Fullerton needs    is a little jamaharon.       No. A lot of jamaharon.
I'd buy him a horga'hn myself if    I thought held take it.
It looks like he's not the only    one who could use some cheering    up.
I've had better vacations.
Better than Risa?
I never knew a Klingon who had a    tougher time enjoying himself.
That's no reason for you not to    have a good time. Risa is famous    for its... diversions.
I wish it was that simple.
It was for Curzon Dax. And I can   tell, there's more than a little   Curzon in you.
He really loved this planet.
And Risa loved him.
Why don't I give you a hand   cleaning up?
All that is ours is yours.
Our paths have grown apart.
What was one is now two.
The time of sharing is over.
May the Prophets guide you toward    the path of happiness.
And may they walk with you always.
That's it?
That's it.
What were you expecting?

I was expecting some fireworks.    Where's the anger, the vicious    name-calling, the irrational    accusations? I never would've    agreed to be a witness if I knew    you were going to be so... civil.    It's disgusting.
Personally, I think it's    admirable. No incriminations, no    hurt feelings. I've never felt so    good about the end of a    relationship.
I agree. Now I can finally be    honest about my feelings.
What does that mean?
It's just... for the past few    months I've been... I don't    know... thinking a lot about...    another man.
Let me get this straight, while    you were still dating Julian here,    you were having fantasies about    someone else.
I'd rather not discuss it now.
You brought it up, you might as    well tell me who it is.
Yes, do tell.
It's...
Me?
Your brother Rom.
My brother Rom?
His brother Rom?
He's so cute. And very sexy.
Cute?
Sexy?
Rom?
Here. You need this more than I   do.
Doesn't the clay feel good?
Wonderful.
Now pour your emotions into it.    Begin to mold it. Feel the    texture in your hands.
Dax.
Worf?
Worf!
I'm tired of giving speeches.    It's time we took action.
We've taken action. The raid on    the Solarium...
It'll be forgotten by tomorrow.
Enter.
Mister Worf?
You want to make people leave    Risa? I think I know a way.

I have to admit, I probably    would've reacted the same way Worf    did. I know Arandis was Curzon's    lover, not yours, but if I'd    walked in and seen the two of you    together... trying to figure you    out at any given moment isn't    exactly easy.
scene: 53   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: I like that about her.
scene: 53   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: So do I. It's why I chased after    her for so long.
scene: 53   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: Would you please stop talking    about me like I'm not here.
scene: 53   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: But it's also why I stopped    chasing her.       You're too much work.
scene: 53   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: Worf is the one who's too much    work.
scene: 53   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: What you need is a Ferengi.
scene: 53   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: Maybe.       But what I want is Worf.
scene: 53   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: Why?
scene: 53   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: Because he has the courage of a    berserker cat and the heart of a    poet.
scene: 53   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: And the brain of a pigheaded    idiot.
scene: 53   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: Sometimes.
scene: 53   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: Any luck?
scene: 53   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: I'm afraid not. None of the staff    has seen him. But I'm sure he'll    turn up.
scene: 53   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: Well, no sense waiting around here    for him. I say we all take some    floaters up into the hills and go    skinny dipping in the hot springs.
scene: 53   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: I never thought I'd say this...    but I'm with Quark.
scene: 53   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: What was that?
scene: 53   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: Great. Just what we needed.
scene: 53   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: I thought it wasn't supposed to    rain in this part of Risa.
scene: 53   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: It's not. Something must've gone    wrong with the weather grid.
scene: 53   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: Could I please have your    attention. Obviously the weather    grid is experiencing some kind of    malfunction. But I'm sure we'll    be able to repair it soon.
No you won't.
You're responsible for this?
I authorized it. But it wasn't my    idea.
It was mine.
You're not serious.
He's serious. What did you do,    Worf? Build an uplink so you    could take control of the weather    grid?

The grid has been deactivated.    It'll take three or four days to   restore the system to normal    operation. During that time, the    inhabitants of Risa and their    guests will experience the    planet's natural weather cycle.
And for most of Risa, that means    rain. And plenty of it.
But why are you doing this?
Because Risa is an illusion    created by weather control    systems, industrial replicators,    and seismic regulators.
And if the Federation is going to    survive, we're going to have to    stop wasting our time with toys    and get back to the essentials.
I'm beginning to think there's no    hope for that man.       or for you either, Mister Worf.
Commander, with all due respect...    have you lost you mind?
I think you'll find me quite    rational.
As rational as Klingons get,    anyway.
Worf, this is wrong.
I disagree. If Federation    citizens cannot handle a little    bad weather, how will they handle    a Dominion invasion?
I've seen drier days on    Ferenginar. And we have a hundred    and seventy-eight different words    for rain. Right now it's    "glebbening" out there. And    that's bad.
If you're so unhappy, take your    horga'hn and find some company.
Have you taken a good look at the    Risians lately? They're even more    depressed than the guests.
I'm trying to organize a game of    hoverball. Would either of you    like to join us?
In the rain?
No, on one of the indoor courts.
Indoor hoverball. That's just    wrong.
I'll play.
Good, that makes one.
Having trouble keeping the guests    happy?
I've never heard so much    complaining in my life.
No one came here to sit around in    the rain.
It's not just the weather. People    are starting to complain about    everything. Their rooms, the    entertainment, the food.
What's wrong with the food?
Nothing, as far as I can tell.    But the guests are starting to say    it doesn't taste right.
It's the humidity.       It dampens the food, makes    everything mushy. Trust me.    There's no word for "crisp" on    Ferenginar.
Maybe Mister Fullerton is right.    Maybe we have forgotten how to    deal with adversity.
According to our figures, the    guest population has declined    thirty percent in the last three    days.
And you can be sure the guests    who've stayed are taking what you    have to say seriously.
It's a start.
One that you can build on.       Good luck.
You're leaving?
I've had my fill of Risa.
Mister Worf, you've been an    inspiration to us all.
You still have the uplink to the    weather control grid?
Right here.
By tomorrow, the weather grid will    be restored to normal and no one    here will remember this ever happened.       But I intend to send a message    they won't forget.
Their response only proves my    point.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: I see. You ruined the vacations    of a few hundred thousand people    to bolster the moral fiber of the    Federation.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: I don't expect you to understand.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: I understand. Even better than    you do. What you did had nothing    to do with Risa, or the    Essentialists, or the Federation.       It was about you and me.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: You give yourself far too much    credit.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: Do I? You think I'm    irresponsible, frivolous. That I    care more about pleasure than I do    about commitment.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: (cutting to the heart of     the matter)   What do you think is going on    between Arandis and me?
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: You know what I think.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: That's right I do. And you know    what? You're wrong.       Did it occur to you to ask me    about it? Or even trust, just a    little?
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: A Klingon woman would never even    give me grounds for suspicion.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: How would you know? Curzon spent    more time around Klingons than you    ever did.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: You may have lived among my    people, but you are not a Klingon.    I am.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: Maybe so. But you're not like any    other Klingon I've ever met.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: What happened to you, Worf?    You're a paragon of Klingon honor    and discipline, but when it comes    to the Klingon passion for life,    the exuberance, the enjoyment of    the moment, you're constantly    holding yourself back. Why?
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: That's not the issue here.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: I think it is.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: I do not wish to lose you,    Jadzia.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: Then talk to me. Please.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: You know that from the age of    seven I was raised by humans on    the farmworld of Gault?
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: It was a sparsely populated world    of not more than twenty thousand    inhabitants. It often seemed as    if everyone knew everyone else.    But one thing was for certain...   everyone knew me.       I was the Klingon child. The    "uncontrollable" one. I was the    biggest, strongest, most fearless    child on the entire planet. I    fought hard, I played hard, I did    as I pleased.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: What changed?
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: When I was thirteen, I was captain    of my school soccer team. We made    it to the championships, and I was    determined to win. Near the end    of the second half, with the score    tied, my team got a corner kick.    The ball sailed up high. Both I    and one of my opponents, a human    boy named Mikel, leaped up to head    the ball. He had position, but I    was determined to score. I    remember laughing with excitement    as I threw myself at him.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: Go on.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: The next thing I knew, the ball    was sailing into their goal. I    roared in triumph and turned to    Mikel, to gloat, only to find him    lying on the grass bleeding. Our    heads had collided when we went up    for the ball. I didn't even feel    the impact, but I'd broken his    neck. He died the next day.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: It was an accident.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: Which only makes it worse.    Compared to Klingons, humans are    fragile creatures. I realized at    that moment that to live among    them I would have to practice...   restraint.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: That must've been difficult for you.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: At first. But in time, it became    part of who I was, who I am.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: And you're still afraid that if    you lose control...
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: Someone I care about might get   hurt.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: That explains a lot.        But you have to realize, there're    some things in life you just can't    control. And one of them is me.        But what you can do is trust me.    I care about you Worf. And I    would never do anything to hurt    you.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: Nor would I do anything to hurt    you.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: Who knows, I might have more self-   control than you give me credit    for.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: That felt like an earthquake.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: so did that.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: The Essentialists.
scene: 61   INT. DAX AND WORF'S GUEST CHAMBER - DAY

quote: You should see them all run. I   think they've finally realized   that the party's over.
Increase the feedback in the    tectonic stress regulators.
If I do, there won't be a building    left standing in this part of    Risa.
It might be a good idea to head    for the spaceport.       Or at least get out of this room.
Very well. I think we're done    here.
The uplink. Give it to me.
Mister Worf, I suggest you all get    off this planet as soon as    possible. I have no wish to see    you or your friends harmed.
Give us the uplink or the only   person who'll be "harmed" is you.
I thought you were one of us.
Perhaps I was... for a time. But    I believe the Federation will    survive the Dominion, the Borg...    and even people like you.

If you walk out of here now,    you'll be turning your back on the    Federation. Don't you see,    overindulgence, lack of self-control,    they'll destroy everything we hold    dear. And you'll be responsible.
You say we have to return to    traditional Federation values? I    agree. But one of those values is    trust. It is "Essential," we    remember that.
Don't you walk away from me.
I'll do as I please. I'm on   vacation.
Figures. The weather improves the    day we leave.
I can't wait to get home.    (to Arandis,     apologetically)   Not that I didn't enjoy myself.
I'd better go find Doctor Bashir.    He brought a horga'hn down to    breakfast and that's the last I    saw of him.
I hope the two of you will visit    Risa again.
I did not think I'd be welcome.
You still have a lot to learn    about my people.
I never got a chance to say    good-bye to Curzon Dax.
And you're not saying good-bye to    me either. I'll be back.
Risa will be waiting.
So what do we do now?
Now...       We watch the sun set.
I have a better idea. Let's go   for a swim.
I don't have a bathing suit.
I won't tell if you won't.
